---
title: "`rename_column` Action"
---

The `rename_column` action is used to rename a column that exists in a table as part of the `ALTER` SQL command.

## Input Parameters

There is a single `msgpack` serialized parameter passed to the action.

```c++
// The base class for all alter parameters.
struct AirportAlterBase
{
  //! Catalog name to alter
  std::string catalog;
  //! Schema name to alter
  std::string schema;
  //! Entry name to alter
  std::string name;
  bool ignore_not_found;
};

struct AirportAlterTableRenameColumnParameters : AirportAlterBase
{
  std::string old_name;
  std::string new_name;

  MSGPACK_DEFINE_MAP(catalog, schema, name, ignore_not_found, new_name, old_name);
};
```

## Return Value

The action does not return a value, but should raise a Arrow Flight exception if there is an error.
